channel.title: Apple Products are they really worth it?
channel.description:
Are apple products really worth it, because all i see is a device released with tons of glory then in 2 years they either ruin it or making it better. Like my old iPod Video that is a 5G version. They made a new version which the call Classic is bigger then the previous one. Is that fair?
I see no reason in getting the current iPod Video due to how it looks too much like their previous models

item.title: Apple Products are they really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:46, topic:219833”][quote author=Ckstunnerscape link=topic=288716.msg2375301#msg2375301 date=1218384344]
Wow, Most people on here that say bad things about Mac’s have never used one Rofl
[/quote]

I was using Apple Macs before you were thought of, little man.[/quote]

Lol probly same here, problem is I haven’t used one since then

Read full topic
item.source: Apple Products are they really worth it?

item.title: Apple Products are they really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:47, topic:219833”]I think they are worth it. While they are costly, quality comes with a price. A lot of people just say Macs are bad without using one. They never say what is exactly wrong, or what they personally don’t like. PCWorld said the fastest Vista notebook they tested was a Mac. A Mac can run Mac OS X, Windows XP or Vista, and many types of Linux. Think of it as just another brand like Gateway or Dell.

Plus the hardware is made by Apple, which takes away the problems such as missing drivers and incompatibility issues. I have an old original iPod nano, and it still works great.
I look at it this way, Mac + Windows > Windows.
And yes, my Mac has crashed before, I don’t expect it to be perfect as no OS is.[/quote]

They don’t make the CPU, and I’m sure there are other pieces of Hardware not manufactured by them. The famous “Designed and Tested in California.” statement comes to mind. A lot of what goes into an Intel Mac now comes from the same factories as other generic PC’s.

I’ve had many problems with incompatibility in the past. Mainly because it’s a Microsoft game, and others find it hard to join along. I bought a Netgear 802.11g USB Wifi Adapter, that was Windows only. I didn’t read the box until after I bought it, and wouldn’t you know. Open Box policy.

Read full topic
item.source: Apple Products are they really worth it?

item.title: Apple Products are they really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

I think they are worth it. While they are costly, quality comes with a price. A lot of people just say Macs are bad without using one. They never say what is exactly wrong, or what they personally don’t like. PCWorld said the fastest Vista notebook they tested was a Mac. A Mac can run Mac OS X, Windows XP or Vista, and many types of Linux. Think of it as just another brand like Gateway or Dell.

Plus the hardware is made by Apple, which takes away the problems such as missing drivers and incompatibility issues. I have an old original iPod nano, and it still works great.
I look at it this way, Mac + Windows > Windows.
And yes, my Mac has crashed before, I don’t expect it to be perfect as no OS is.

Read full topic
item.source: Apple Products are they really worth it?

item.dc:creator: @reVein reVein
item.description:
@reVein wrote:

The ipods are worth the money, but the macs definitely aren’t. Apple says that the mac’s DO NOT CRASH, which is a total lie since they crash, and unlike on pc it’s nearly impossible to find the source of the crash on apple.

item.title: Apple Products are they really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

I think perhaps he’s sick of people altering the things he says which intentionally were positive into negative things against the company.

Yay for you community idiots!

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:224613”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=288716.msg2372547#msg2372547 date=1218290414]

I think Apple are very creative with their products, and bring out things other companies haven’t thought of.

Yeah, cuz mp3 players weren’t around before the ipod.
[/quote]

I think he meant the appearance, OS, how it works, etc. Not exactly what music it can play.[/quote]
Exactly what i meant. iPods are so much easier to use than any other MP3 player i’ve ever seen. They’re also very organised and have other useful features.

[quote=“sanga282, post:41, topic:219833”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=288716.msg2372547#msg2372547 date=1218290414]

I think Apple are very creative with their products, and bring out things other companies haven’t thought of.

Yeah, cuz mp3 players weren’t around before the ipod.
[/quote]
i think perhaps he means useless things apple do ie making laptops really light, the feutile things[/quote]
A mistake on their behalf, but hello example of forum idiot. waves

item.title: Apple Products are they really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Hardware costs more from apple because people are willing to pay for it. It’s how apple advertises. People want exclusivity, and that comes with a price. That’s why you don’t buy RAM from apple. You buy it from Newegg, just the same as with any other PC company, you’re going to get a better deal somewhere else.

Macbook Air is missing quite a few features, and that’s for a reason. Read this article, here. It does take some time to import 12,000 songs into itunes and convert it. It takes the same amount of time for any other media player that uses a library.

Read full topic
item.source: Apple Products are they really worth it?

item.title: Apple Products are they really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:31, topic:219833”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=288716.msg2351446#msg2351446 date=1217025035]

Of course they’re not worth it; they’re made by a big money-caring company.

Every company cares about money…

Not all care about it more than give the custumers a great product, nice price and FREEDOM.
Look like company like Opera Software ASA, Novell, Canonical Ltd and the Mozilla guys.
They give good OS/Programs, their programs/OS does not cost anything. (Except one version of Opera’s mobile browser.)
They have no reason to wait to give out features. (Like Microsoft have, since they don’t released DirectX 10 on XP they give XP user one reason to upgrade.)
None of them have big market share, that does that they must make good product unlike Microsoft that only can make some crap and force PC shops to sell it, or Apple that lock their users to a locked iHell.

Google, TPC, Opera, Firefox, Wikipedia, OpenOffice, Ubuntu, Arch Linux and GIMP is all free to use (Some free like free beer, and some like the other meaning of free.).

Apple have not invented anything good, just steal TVs from a rich neighbour.
[/quote]

You’re talking about software companies. Apple has to sell hardware as well. The whole thing about Market Share is wrong. Apple has a small market share. And this iHell isn’t even a problem. I convert all of my songs(over 12,000) in itunes, plug my iPod in, and sync in. And I’m done.

You cannot put Apple in the same boat with Microsoft. They’re opposites. To try and compare apple and Microsoft is stupid. Apple does not wait to release products, in fact they let their community develop applications for them. Apple dominates when it comes to sales because they do what they do, the right way.

Apple has good products. I’ve never had any real trouble with them whatsoever. And to knock something without at least trying it is wrong.[/quote]
Hardware from Apple cost more than other PCs with the same spec.
If you try to upgrade RAM from Apple store it will cost you much more than upgrading a PC.

Macbook air, missing lots of things a PC should have and it expensive.
Who care then about its fit in an envelope.

How long does converting 12000 songs take?
If it takes more than 10 minnutes it takes to long time.

Read full topic
item.source: Apple Products are they really worth it?

item.title: Apple Products are they really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:28, topic:219833”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=288716.msg2351411#msg2351411 date=1217017811]

Of course they’re not worth it; they’re made by a big money-caring company.

Every company cares about money…
[/quote]
Not all care about it more than give the custumers a great product, nice price and FREEDOM.
Look like company like Opera Software ASA, Novell, Canonical Ltd and the Mozilla guys.
They give good OS/Programs, their programs/OS does not cost anything. (Except one version of Opera’s mobile browser.)
They have no reason to wait to give out features. (Like Microsoft have, since they don’t released DirectX 10 on XP they give XP user one reason to upgrade.)
None of them have big market share, that does that they must make good product unlike Microsoft that only can make some crap and force PC shops to sell it, or Apple that lock their users to a locked iHell.

Google, TPC, Opera, Firefox, Wikipedia, OpenOffice, Ubuntu, Arch Linux and GIMP is all free to use (Some free like free beer, and some like the other meaning of free.).

Apple have not invented anything good, just steal TVs from a rich neighbour.[/quote]

You’re talking about software companies. Apple has to sell hardware as well. The whole thing about Market Share is wrong. Apple has a small market share. And this iHell isn’t even a problem. I convert all of my songs(over 12,000) in itunes, plug my iPod in, and sync in. And I’m done.

You cannot put Apple in the same boat with Microsoft. They’re opposites. To try and compare apple and Microsoft is stupid. Apple does not wait to release products, in fact they let their community develop applications for them. Apple dominates when it comes to sales because they do what they do, the right way.

Apple has good products. I’ve never had any real trouble with them whatsoever. And to knock something without at least trying it is wrong.

Read full topic
item.source: Apple Products are they really worth it?

item.title: Apple Products are they really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Yes, they all do, but they i mention does also care about their customers and products.
Microsoft and Apple can easy earn money with a bad product, that cannot the small companies like Opera Software ASA, Novell, Canonical Ltd and the Mozilla guys, they need to make things that people want.
You would never use Opera/Firefox if that Sucks, but lots of people use IE that sucks because they are to lazy the change, they don’t know that Windows and IE is opening Windows and door to let viruses come in to your system.

And Apple, most people uses their iTunes if they have an iPhone that also sucks, its hard to use and after that I have heard it only supports two formats (Correct me if I have wrong.).

Every companies must have money to run, but not every need good products to run. (Microsoft and Apple.)

Read full topic
